value:
I must admit, I feel somewhat out of
place here. There aren't many other
Heroes wearing a kimono...$k$pAnd I'm the only one carrying mochi
around.

I was celebrating the new year at
Castle Shirasagi, unprepared to be
summoned out of the blue.$k$pNormally I'd have my Fujin Yumi with
me, but...

It's always so cold at the turn of a new
year. Are you warm enough? I wish I
had some warm ozoni with me...

Huh? You want to make up some
New Year's fortunes? Fine...$k$pYou'll have good luck if there are at
least three Hoshidan Heroes in the
plaza.

It's a new year, so I'll try to be a little
more forthright. I wanted you to know
that I respect your tactical capabilities.

Happy New Year. I was instructed by
$Nf to deliver
new-year greetings.

As amazing as the first sunrise
of the new year.

This year, I'll become even
stronger.

I hope the entire year doesn't go
this way...

A new power for a new year,
huh? Thanks.

Happy New Year. I'm Takumi, Prince
of Hoshido. Are we...exchanging
new-year gifts?

I've been here since the new year's
start. Do you celebrate New Year's
where you're from?$k$pWe have all sorts of traditions in
Hoshido.$k$pFor instance, we'll hang decorations
resembling the Dawn Dragon facing
the sunrise to ward off evil.$k$pWe also have many delicious soups
we'll prepare— Hm? Why are you
looking at me like that?$k$pOh, you'd like to learn more about
Hoshidan New Year's traditions?$k$pWell, they're pretty involved, and
explaining them thoroughly will likely
take some time...$k$pBut as long as you're OK with that, I'd
be glad to tell you whatever you want
to know.$k$pI can't say whether it's good fortune or
bad, but there's no way of knowing if
I'll ever be able to return home...$k$pSo, for as long as I'm here, I'll
continue to chat with you like this.
After all, I don't...dislike you.$k$pSo let's keep working together.
Sound good?
やあっ！
えいっ！
ええっ！？
I said cut it out!
Happy New Year!
Here's a present!
We're celebrating my way!
Say hello to a new year!
Back to sleep...
Heh
This is just something I wear for the New Year!
I always have bad dreams. But they seem even worse at the start of a new year.
What? Men wear kimonos like this for the New Year in Hoshido!
It's Hoshidan tradition to give money to children on New Year's Day. That's...nice, I guess.
Hoping for good luck this year? Yeah, me too.
I never expected to go into battle wearing this.
Sorry if I can be...prickly. Truth is, I'm glad to be with you for the New Year.
Mm-hmm?
Party time.
All right.
The year's barely started and busy already?
